## AQ-20 vs ADOS: A Comparative Study

In autism research, two key instruments frequently brought to the table are the Autism Spectrum Quotient (revised) or AQ-20 and the Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule or ADOS. These two instruments serve profoundly different roles in diagnosing and understanding autistic tendencies among participants. Nevertheless, a comparison between AQ-20 and ADOS offers valuable insights into the nuances of autism that could potentially revolutionize its diagnosis and treatment. The AQ-20 is a self-report measure focusing on the wide array of autistic behaviors and traits, while the ADOS uses observational methods to determine whether the individual's behavior aligns with an autistic disorder. Comparing these unique approaches could lead to an optimized usage of both tools, enabling a more holistic view of the individual's tendencies.


## Compare the items in AQ-20 and ADOS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import AQ-20 and ADOS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AQ-20 into Harmony</a> - compare AQ-20 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just ADOS into Harmony</a> - compare ADOS with other instruments


Given the potential benefits of comparing AQ-20 vs ADOS, we recommend utilizing the intelligent software - Harmony. Harmony, a product of cutting-edge technological advancements, is a tool that seamlessly harmonises items from both AQ-20 and ADOS using large language models. It offers the opportunity to assess each item's correlation in both instruments for a comprehensive comparison and understanding of AQ-20 vs ADOS.
